Well, yes and no. Sure, I can talk about Tom Cruise's baby with the best of them.
The price of oil, the latest Italian restaurant that just opened up in that part of town that was once dead, but now is becoming so hip.
You see, knowledge is never random.
We choose to talk about things, even small things, because they connect us to some part of ourselves.
With the exception of black people themselves, race evidently connects no one to anything anymore, and that alarms me.

It's taken me about 20 years to accept that history moves, not in straight lines but in ellipses and circles, and that the window of the ‘60s that we take for granted was one of the biggest aberrations in American history.
So, the job of my generation, as it was for all the generations before it, is to agitate.
That means, among other things, to remind people at parties, and boardrooms, and newsrooms, and in line at Starbucks - of who we are, of who we were.
I owe Uncle Lester at least that much.
